intro: Piper bullulatum, commonly known as the bullulatum pepper or the little bell pepper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant produces small, bell-shaped fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. These fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some local cuisines. Its botanical features include compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters.
